alert.note: Alert for Modoc County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 26 at 2:48PM PDT until March 28 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM MONDAY TO 2 PM PDT TUESDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM MONDAY TO 11 AM PDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...In far western Modoc County, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 13 inches. For the rest of Modoc County west of Canby, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...For the warning area, Western Modoc County. For the Advisory, the communities of Day, Lookout, and Tionesta, as well as Highway 139 north of Canby. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from 5 PM Monday to 2 PM PDT Tuesday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 5 PM Monday to 11 AM PDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates could approach 1 inch per hour Monday night through Tuesday morning. The combination of strong winds and snow will result in reduced visibilities and occasional whiteout conditions. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. Do not detour during winter storms. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is imminent and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.
